1387931440059494407.text: Ultimately, with my Restoring Community Input & Public Protections in Oil & Gas Leasing Act, we can reduce greenhouse gas emissions AND protect the environment, private landowners, and taxpayer interests.

1387931438943768578.text:
Myth: Eliminating noncompetitive leasing will hurt taxpayers and states.

Fact: Noncompetitive leasing is an outdated process that lets companies acquire vast tracks of public lands for less than a cup of ☕.

1387931437794566149.text:
Myth: Companies disclose enough information, and citizens have more than enough ways to engage in the leasing process.

Fact: Companies nominate public lands for auction anonymously and with no fee. My bill fixes this.

1387931435902939142.text:
Myth: Restricting U.S. oil & gas drilling is worse for the environment.

Fact: Reducing consumption of fossil fuels is the best thing we can do to protect our planet. We should focus on clean energy solutions instead of drilling for more oil.

1387931434657230848.text: Unfortunately, we continue to hear the same false and tired arguments from my colleagues across the aisle in opposition to the commonsense fixes in my bill, so I want to debunk some myths for everyone ⬇️:

1387931433126219784.text: Yesterday, in @NRDems, we discussed my bill to make sure the American people shape how we protect and manage our cherished public lands, not the fossil fuel industry. (🧵)

1308833450791755783.text: I’ve said it before and I’ll say it again: Even one homeless veteran is one too many, and we have a moral obligation to make robust federal investments in programs to help get veterans off our streets.

1308833449600577536.text: And it includes the Bill Mulder Transition Improvement Act, a bill I introduced with @RepArrington to make to make the transition process easier for servicemembers returning to civilian life.

1308833448514256896.text: It includes the Veterans Economic Recovery Act, a bill I introduced with @DrPhilRoe to create a rapid retraining program for unemployed veterans and reservists.

1308833447419543553.text: It includes my Housing for Women Veterans Act, a bill I introduced with @RepBrianFitz to require the VA to complete an analysis of its programs that provide assistance to women veterans who are homeless to identify the areas in which such programs are failing to meet their needs.

1308833446274490369.text: It includes the Reducing Veteran Homelessness Act, a bill I introduced with @GOPLeader to ensure that homeless veterans and their families receive the resources and services they deserve by filling gaps in HUD-VASH case management.

1308833445137784833.text: It includes the Veteran HOUSE Act, a bill I co-led with @RepScottPeters to expand the HUD-VASH program to homeless veterans discharged under conditions other-than-honorable.

1308833443342692353.text: It includes the Homeless Veteran Coronavirus Response Act, a bill I introduced with my friend @RepGusBilirakis to expand and strengthen VA services for homeless veterans during the COVID-19 pandemic.

1308832459132407808.text: Today, the House took a significant step in making sure homeless and unemployed veterans have the support they deserve. I was proud to lead the DELIVER Act, major legislation that includes 6 of my bipartisan bills to help get veterans back on their feet. https://t.co/uN4GPqQBLn

I flew to Washington late last night to make sure the bipartisan #CARESAct passes as soon as possible for the people of #CA49. 

The bill isn’t perfect, but it’s a strong step in the right direction. https://t.co/HdRiJ996Ck

1243382174511796226.text: Getting on a red eye. Too much is at stake and Americans can’t afford to wait any longer. https://t.co/W4X3wglXqM

1243279435563970560.text: While I continue to read through the bill, I know that we will also need to take much more action to address both the health & economic needs of working families, and I will work with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to deliver more relief for families.

1243279432170733574.text: I’m disappointed that it doesn’t include stronger worker protections tied to corporate relief, more support for small municipalities, and environmental standards.

1243279429159321601.text: We know that our economic crisis will not subside until our health crisis is under control. That’s why this bill provides critical funding for state and local governments to provide resources and personal protective equipment for health care workers on the front lines.

1243279426269446147.text: I’m encouraged by what I’ve seen in the bill so far. Families and individuals will receive more paid emergency leave, unemployment insurance, direct cash, nutrition assistance, small business support, and much more.

1243279413598457856.text:
The House received the 880 page bill from the Senate late last night, and we’re expected to pass it tomorrow. 

With more than $2 trillion in spending, I’m going to take all the time I can to read through the fine print and make sure it truly puts families in #CA49 first.

1189604126306504705.text: It’s not just accidental shootings. Over 75 percent of school shootings involve kids and teens having access to unsecured or unsupervised guns at home. And more than 80 percent of guns used by youth in suicide attempts were kept in the home of the victim, a relative, or a friend.

1189604125404733440.text: The #PreventFamilyFire Act provides a modest tax credit to incentivize the sale of things like gun safes. If we expand safe storage, we can reduce accidental shootings by 73 percent. It’s that simple.

1189604124494446592.text: Every single day, eight kids are killed or injured by unintentional shootings with guns found in the home. We can prevent that by expanding safe storage of firearms. Today, I’m introducing a bipartisan bill to do just that. #PreventFamilyFire https://t.co/VwYnpIenNk
